RumorFact.Text: Slate says I should go talk to the hatchlings in the village before I take off.

ExploreFact.Text: Mica says that Chert delayed their first launch several times for some reason.
Mica told me to take off and ask Chert myself for the reason they delayed their first launch.

RumorFact.Text: Slate says I should go talk to the hatchlings in the village before I take off.

ExploreFact.Text: Tephra and Galena noticed the quantum shard in the museum disappearing completely sometimes.
Tephra asked me to find out where the museum's quantum shard goes when it disappears.
Tephra says there might be undiscovered caves at the Nomai Ruins outside the village that the quantum shard travels to.

RumorFact.Text: Slate says I should go talk to the hatchlings in the village before I take off.

ExploreFact.Text: Galena wanted to show me something they made for me. They asked me to shoot my Little Scout up from the exhibit where Rutile is sitting to see what they made.
I used my Little Scout to read a heartwarming sign that Galena made!

RumorFact.Text: Slate says I should go talk to the hatchlings in the village before I take off.
Arkose says Gabbro noticed ghost matter disappearing as well.

ExploreFact.Text: Arkose noticed the patch of ghost matter in the village disappearing sometimes.
Arkose says that Gabbro noticed ghost matter disappearing as well, though they weren't sure why.

RumorFact.Text: Slate says I should go talk to the hatchlings in the village before I take off.
Moraine says I should tell Riebeck about the Nomai mural I found in the waterways.

ExploreFact.Text: Moraine asked if I could dive into a geyser to find anything hidden in the waterways of Timber Hearth.
Moraine says I should tell Riebeck about the Nomai mural I found in the waterways.

RumorFact.Text: My Little Scout traveled with the museum’s quantum shard into a glittering cave somewhere within Timber Hearth.
The Nomai planned to build a Sanctuary within Timber Hearth's underground pools, where a quantum shard traveled.
Ore mined on Timber Hearth was treated at a forge on Hollow's Lantern before being used to reinforce the Sanctuary.
The Nomai planned to use a new invention from the Scroll and Stone Workshop which would provide convenient entry into the Sanctuary.
The Hearthians that survived the arrival of ghost matter within the Sanctuary were quarantined inside by a Nomai named Cassava.

ExploreFact.Text: The Nomai built this Sanctuary to protect the native lifeforms of Timber Hearth during the operation of the Ash Twin Project.
The Hearthians left within the Sanctuary were protected from ghost matter, and quarantined inside this space.
A Nomai named Cycad learnt how to use the rule of entanglement remotely by accidentally disengaging his voyager stone.
"A voyager is unable to observe its surroundings on its own."

RumorFact.Text: Tephra asked me to explore the Nomai Ruins outside the village for undiscovered caves the quantum shard might travel to.

ExploreFact.Text: This campsite belonged to the Nomai working on Timber Hearth.

A Nomai named Oeno modified vision orbs to acommodate Timber Hearth's native lifeforms. She was disappointed to learn the vision orb was not being activated by them, but by the Attlerock’s gravity as it orbited overhead.
A Nomai named Yarrow reported the rotating doors on the Sun Station and Timber Hearth warp towers opening and closing on their own from time to time.
The Nomai planned to build a Sanctuary within Timber Hearth's underground pools, where a quantum shard travels.

RumorFact.Text: A new invention from the Scroll and Stone Workshop on Giant's Deep provides convenient entry into the Sanctuary.

ExploreFact.Text: A warp transmitter requires a connected warp receiver to function.

RumorFact.Text: A Nomai named Cycad delivered news about rotating doors on Ash Twin activating on their own to Timber Hearth.

ExploreFact.Text: A Nomai named Cassava observed ghost matter in this site being pulled up by the Attlerock’s gravity as it orbited overhead.
The Nomai on Timber Hearth were careful not to leave this warp receiver unattended, to protect the amphibious native lifeforms from being warped to Ash Twin.
After a Nomai has warped to it and the warp pad is clear of any entities, a warp receiver powers a return warp that allows travel to its paired warp transmitter once.
